basics.name: Beth Lyon
basics.summary: Clinical Professor of Law and Associate Dean for Experiential Education at Cornell Law School. Founding Director of Farmworker Legal Assistance Clinic with extensive experience in immigration law, human rights, and clinical legal education. International clinical legal education trainer and visiting lecturer with experience supporting global development of clinical legal education.

work.position: Clinical Professor of Law, Associate Dean for Experiential Education and Clinical Program Director, Founding Director, Farmworker Legal Assistance Clinic
work.summary: Guide experiential curriculum and direct Clinical Program. Direct Farmworker Legal Assistance Clinics I, II, III and IV, in which law students provide legal services to farmworkers, farmworker and civil rights advocates, and community organizations. Founded and teach LAW 7233 Faculty at Home Seminar: Beyond English: Law, Lawyering, and Language Difference. Co-founded and co-teach LAW 7957 Clinic Spanish Conversation; LawMed Case Collaboration.
highlights: Chair Clinical Appointments Subcommittee; Experiential Committee
Chaired Public Service Committee, Practitioner-in-Residence Committee
Member, Special Committee on ABA Standards; Self Study Committee
Liaison to New York Courts Permanent Commission on Access to Justice and New York Judiciary

work.position: Professor of Law and Acting Director of Clinical Programs, Founding Director, Farmworker Legal Aid Clinic, Founding Co-Director, Community Interpreter Internship Program
work.summary: Directed Clinical Program and founded Farmworker Legal Aid Clinic in which students provided legal services and know-your-rights outreach presentations to rural agricultural, landscaping, and food industry workers and their families, as well as indigent asylum seekers. Practice areas included employment, deportation defense, and family law.
highlights: Organized and led break service trips in various rural communities
Co-created and -directed interdisciplinary program for undergraduate students who provide interpretation services
Co-taught comparative immigration law course
Advised Hispanic Law Students Association and National Lawyers Guild student chapter
Chaired Inclusiveness Task Force and Admissions Committee
Member, Strategic Planning Task Force

work.summary: Extensive experience supporting the global development of clinical legal education. Co-designed and co-taught workshop in Spanish for two Bolivian Law Schools and three-day national certificate program on clinical legal education for Nicaraguan labor law professors and law school deans.
highlights: Visiting lecturer and demonstration clinical teacher (Zhejiang Gongshang University, South China University of Technology School of Law, and Bennett Law School)
Plenary Presenter and Small Group Leader for four national and regional trainings (China, Hungary, and Romania)
Presented at Global Alliance for Justice Education conferences (India, New York)

work.company: George Washington University Law School and University of Oxford
work.summary: Taught Human Rights Advocacy and Dissemination in University of Oxford summer program.

work.company: Washington College of Law, American University
work.summary: Three-year teaching fellowship at International Human Rights Law Clinic teaching lawyering seminar and supervising students handling political asylum cases, habeas corpus litigation in federal district court, and petitions before human rights bodies.
highlights: Designed LLM externship seminar entitled "Lawyering Across Cultures"
Taught seminar on "Economic, Social and Cultural Rights"
Guest lectured in other law school courses
Assisted with developing initiative on gender in the Indian legal curriculum

work.company: Centre on Housing Rights and Evictions
work.summary: Wrote guide to advocacy with the U.N. Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights.

Directed Washington asylum representation program. Represented asylum seekers and supervised caseload of 200 active cases, interviewing and screening indigent asylum seekers, recruiting, training and supervising volunteer counsel in area law firms.
highlights: Designed training course on asylum and detention advocacy
Conducted administrative and legislative advocacy
Managed government liaison process for a national network of asylum rights advocates

work.summary: Drafted guide for agencies seeking Violence Against Women Act funding.

work.company: Comisión Andina de Juristas, Lima Office
work.summary: Monitored legislative revisions of Peruvian constitution. Researched U.S. and Peruvian systems of judicial nomination, death penalty legislation and referenda.
